alert.note: Alert for Anchorage (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 4:07PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...PERIODS OF RAINFALL WILL CONTINUE ACROSS SOUTHCENTRAL THROUGH SATURDAY... An upper low slowly moving into Southcentral continues to pump Gulf moisture into the region with numerous showers lifting into the Anchorage Bowl. As the low makes further eastward progress, southwest flow ahead of the low, and up Cook Inlet, will bring additional moisture and showers Friday into Saturday. Expected additional rainfall amounts through Saturday: Anchorage Bowl: 0.50" to 0.75" This additional rain could push small streams and creeks to, or slightly above, bankfull. Smaller rivers could see water levels rise to bankfull; however, water levels along larger rivers are expected to remain below bankfull. In urban areas, ponding of water and localized flooding on poorly drained roadways is also possible. Please use caution when driving or when recreating along or on area waterways. For additional information and updates to forecasts, please visit www.weather.gov/afc
